review: There are a lot of pros to the Chromecast. It's easy to set up, but so are the competitors, it can mirror what you're watching or have selected on a phone or tablet but, so can competitors. Functionality wise, it's can do the things other boxes can do, and at that point, it is experience that matters. And unfortunately, the experience with the Chromecast is disappointing.The lag time between selecting a show in Netflix and it starting to load on the TV is just long enough to wonder if it's not working. Then the show has to start loading. I understand that there will be a load time with any streaming service, but Chromecast's load times were shockingly long (all use on a functioning 50mbps connection).There was also an audio lag of about a quarter second on all shows, across multiple apps. I tested in multiple HDMI ports, and nothing changed.The lack of remote is also annoying, not a deal breaker, but it feels like you need to dedicate a device to your TV.The device feels like it's 'good enough.' If you've never used another streaming box or dongle, it's fine, but Apple TV or Roku users who might be looking for a step up from their current devices should stay put, as the Chromecast is a step down in function and quality.
